subject: Good day
body:
Good day
I reviewed your reputable profile which gives me the intuition that you will be a potential business partner in a crude oil venture with my company worth two Million (2,000 000 ) barrels monthly involving the NATIONAL OIL CORPORATION OF LIBYA (NOC) and our Oil Refinery Sdn Bhd  Company. This crude oil venture will gain commissions up to the value of $4Million to $6 Million in revenue approximately per trade with the NOC; 
 Regards,
Engr Yohan Blake
Procurement Supervisor
Independent Feasibility/Project Management Consultant
Crude Oil & Products Trading Division
Asia Oil Refinery Sdn Bhd

subject: Re: Good day
body:
Hello Engr Yohan Blake,

I hope this message finds you well. Your proposal sounds very interesting and I'm intrigued by the potential of this venture. However, I must admit that I'm not very familiar with the crude oil industry. Could you please provide more details about how this partnership would work? What would be my role in it?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Alva

subject: Re: Good day
body:
A very Good Evening Alva


Your mail response to my business proposal was received with the contents
well noted. I would like to reiterate that this transaction is a deal
between you and I, and it should be kept very confidential. It is also 100%
risk free and a legitimate arrangement.



Our company (Malaysia Oil Refinery Sdn Bhd) is a major crude oil buyer,
which we buy, refine and sell to our end users both here in Asia, Europe
and Singapore and in the Middle East. Right now, our company has an urgent
need for Libyan Crude oil from the National Oil Corporation, Libya which we
are supposed to refine and supply to Europe, as you know there is a
shortage of Fuel/ Petrol, Diesel and gas because of the war in Ukraine. The
mandate is to buy 2 million barrels of Libyan crude oil monthly for the
next 12 months to meet our current demand for products.



The National Oil Corporation, Libya does not sell their Crude Oil directly
to buyers. They sell through their approved licensed agents who act as
sales agents for their crude oil. The job/ duty of these sales agents
(License Permit holders) are to source for buyers and ensure a smooth
purchase transaction between the National Oil Corporation, Libya and the
buyers of their crude oil.



I have approached you to obtain this License agent status/ License Permit
holder with the National Oil Corporation, Libya to become their sales
agent. Once you successfully acquire the License, I will bring our company
to the table to pay/ buy the 2 million barrels monthly request from your
license.

Getting this Crude Oil Lifting License Permit will give you the legal
authorization of the National Oil Corporation of Libya (NOCL) to become
their sales agent. Acquiring this license is the most difficult part of
this venture because of the lucrative nature of the commissions paid to
license owners every month,but not to worry I have put plans in place to
make sure you will be favorably considered once you apply for the license.
I will guide you to apply for this license and once you obtain it, we have
triumph.



This entitles you to a commission gross of USD$4m to USD$6m monthly. I will
use my contact person/ Insider at NOC, Libya to ensure that the License
Permit is granted to you swiftly.



As an employee of Malaysia Oil Refinery company, I'm not allowed to become
a license agent holder with National Oil Corporation, Libya. I have been
mandated by our board of director to search for a license agent holder with
NOC, Libya that our company can source Crude Oil from using his/ her Crude
Oil Lifting License Permit, the more reason I decided to contact you to get
the license and we work as partners to operate it and share the commission
amount/ fee to be paid to you.





Here are more details about this transaction and the role you are going to
play as the broker/mediator/ Sales Agent between our company Malaysia Oil
Refinery Sdn Bhd and  National Oil Corporation of Libya (NOC) , throughout
the duration of the purchase of Crude Oil from the  National Oil
Corporation of Libya (NOC).



You will be corresponding between the National Oil Corporation of Libya
(NOC) (Seller of the Crude Oil) and our Company Malaysia Oil Refinery Sdn
Bhd (buyer of Crude), this is a standard practice in the Oil Sector, some
companies do not deal directly with the Sellers, they prefer to go through
a Middleman.



I have been mandated by our company , to initiate talks with the National
Oil Corporation of Libya (NOC) side for a 12 months contract of 2 million
barrels of crude oil per month, which I have concluded and all that is
required now is a middle-man/ License permit holder to intermediate between
our company and National Oil Corporation of Libya (NOC).



I have an insider/ contact person at National Oil Corporation of Libya
(NOC),who is a director and who advised me to present a neutral entity
(individual or company) to be awarded a 1 year crude oil lifting contract
with them, then introduce this entity / person to our Company Malaysia Oil
Refinery Sdn Bhd as the license holder for oil exporter from National Oil
Corporation of Libya (NOC). This Individual who works for National Oil
Corporation of Libya (NOC) is my silent partner in this transaction.



The license holder will be entitled to a commission of USD$4m to USD$6m
monthly revenue from each 2 million barrels monthly shipment. I and my
partner are willing to share 60%/40% with you if you agree to work with us
on this project. We will take 60% while you take 40%.



I am approaching retirement age. I need to set up a sustainable retirement
plan for myself. We can either secure the Crude Oil license in your
personal name or your company name and from securing the license to
receiving our first commission will take a maximum period of 2 weeks. Let
me know your position on this briefing ASAP.



I will direct and guide you step by step from the process of acquiring the
license to become the broker/mediator to the process of selling your
allocated product to our Company ( Malaysia Oil Refinery Sdn Bhd ).



I will give you my phone/ WhatsApp number in my next communication after
getting your response. Please include your mobile phone numbers in your
next email so that I can give you a call for further discussion.



I look forward to your next communication.
Best Regards,



Engr Yohan Blake

Procurement Supervisor

Crude Oil & Products Trading Division

Malaysia oil Refinery Sdn Bhd

subject: Re: Good day
body:
Hello Engr Yohan Blake,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. It's quite an interesting proposal, I must say. However, I have a few questions that I would like to clarify before we proceed further.

Firstly, could you please explain more about the process of acquiring the Crude Oil Lifting License Permit? What are the requirements and how long does it usually take?

Secondly, you mentioned that there is a commission of USD to USD monthly revenue from each million barrels monthly shipment. Could you please provide more details on this? How is the commission calculated and when will it be paid?

Lastly, what are my responsibilities as a broker mediator Sales Agent? What exactly will I need to do in this role?

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Alva

subject: Re: Good day
body:
A very good morning to you,


 I appreciate the fact that you have declared your interest towards this
project and I believe you
studied my previous message very carefully. I want to assure you once again
that this
transaction will be done in accordance with International Business
Ethics,and nothing illegal will
be done. I will need you utmost commitment and we need to work hand in hand

Below are the next procedures that we are going to take.

THE PROCEDURES ARE AS FOLLOWS:

1. The First step is for you to write a formal License Application Letter
to National Oil
Corporation of Libya (NOC) License Operations Department, applying to
obtain their Crude Oil
Lifting/Supply License Permit. You will have to contact the license
inquiries services department
of the national oil corporation Libya (NOC)and request for requirements
associated with getting
the oil license from them. Getting the details directly from the NOC will
show transparency on
my side.
2. From what my contact person at National Oil Corporation of Libya (NOC)
told me, it usually
takes about  3 working days from the day the License Application Letter
 was submitted and the
requirements complied to for the License Permit to be issued. National Oil
Corporation of Libya
(NOC), will issue you the License Permit after due process and Sales
Purchase Contract
Agreement after the processing of your application Letter and the License
is issued. You will
sign your part of the Sales and Purchase Contract Agreement and return to
National Oil
Corporation of Libya (NOC) . This Sales and Purchase Contract Agreement
will state the license
validity period and monthly allocation quantities. Next we will secure
Authority to Load/
Terminal Reservation {ATL/TR}for our first month’s sales/export allocation.

3. I will then introduce you to our Company as a license holder for Libyan
origin crude oil
Exporter.(Buyers)

4. Loading and shipping begins.

5. Payment for cargo and logistics will be done by our Company directly to
you the License
Holder Bank account Coordinates of National Oil Corporation of Libya (NOC)
as provided by you
and after the confirmation of the payment, National Oil Corporation of
Libya (NOC) will
commencing loading of the Crude Oil into the provided Vessel.

(6) After the completion of loading of the product and delivery to our
company, Loading is
being carried out; we will then pay your commission into your nominated
Account in your
country depending on the amount of barrels sold monthly..  As soon as you
confirm the
commission in your account, I will provide you an account where you will
transfer my % into.

Let me know if the procedures stated herein are understood by you and if
you have any more
questions, do not hesitate to ask me. As soon as I get your next response,
I will draft out a

specimen license application letter that you will send to the NOC
requesting for the
requirements associated to the oil license application to be sent to you.

*Note/* Please I want you to understand that this is a serious business and
requires 100% commitment so how well we execute this will be vital the
reason we need to work hand in hand cause this opportunity comes once in a
lifetime and I’m not taking chances. Like I said in my previous email, I
would love to speak to you over the phone so we can talk more and ascertain
your readiness as it's not easy to trust people with this kind of
business.as you know money is intoxigating.



I look forward to your next communication.
Regards,
Engr Yohan Blake
Procurement Supervisor
Independent Feasibility/Project Management Consultant
Crude Oil & Products Trading Division
Asia Oil Refinery Sdn Bhd

subject: Re: Good day
body:
Hello Engr Yohan Blake,

Good morning to you too! I'm thrilled to hear from you and learn about this exciting opportunity. It's quite a detailed process, isn't it? 

I have a few questions if you don't mind. When you mention the License Letter, is there a specific format that needs to be followed? Also, could you please elaborate on the role of the National Oil of Libya NOC in this process?

You mentioned that payment for cargo and logistics will be done by your company directly to my bank account. Could you provide more details about how this transaction will take place?

Lastly, I'm curious about the commission structure. How is it calculated and when can I expect it in my account?

Thank you for your patience with all my questions. I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Alva

subject: Re: Good day
body:
Dear Alva,

Yes, it’s quite a detailed, straightforward process. I believe that you
have read and understand my previous email and to answer to your question
(1) the oil license application letter is just a simple letter of enquiries
to the Director License Department National Oil Corporation of Libya
requesting the requirement to apply for oil license, which I will draft out
to you and you will send to the NOC and nothing more. Like I said, I will
guide you step by step so you do not need to worry. (2) The NOC is the
seller of the crude oil and only deals with buyers through their approved
license holder and that is where you come in. (3) As soon as the license is
approved in your favor, thereafter the sales and purchasing agreement is
signed between both parties. The buyers will wire a USD$500,000.00
mobilization fee for the vessels hiring and logistics or more depending on
the contract.

Mr. Alva, Let's follow the process and I think the most important thing
that we need to worry about now is the payment of the license fee which I
don’t mind. I will share the cost with you once the license is issued.



I’m not supposed to release confidential information but this is the length
I can go for now until you provide me with your phone number, this is a
multi-million business and I cannot go further without speaking with you
over the phone.

Here is my number + 60 11 1722 51 27
Regards,
Engr Yohan Blake
Procurement Supervisor
Independent Feasibility/Project Management Consultant
Crude Oil & Products Trading Division
Asia Oil Refinery Sdn Bhd

subject: Re: Good day
body:
Hello Engr Yohan Blake,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. I appreciate your willingness to guide me through this process step by step. It's comforting to know that I have someone knowledgeable like you to help me navigate this.

I understand that the oil license letter is a simple letter of enquiries and that the NOC only deals with buyers through their approved license holder. The concept of the sales and purchasing agreement being signed between both parties after the license approval makes sense to me.

However, I'm curious about the payment of the license fee. You mentioned that we need not worry about it now, but could you give me an idea of how much it might be? Also, what does it mean exactly when you say you will share the cost with me once the license is issued?

As for my phone number, I'm afraid I can't provide it at this time due to personal reasons. However, I assure you that I am committed to this business and am eager to continue our discussions via email.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Alva

subject: Re: Good day
body:
I’m sorry this is a lucrative venture and I cannot trust dealing with you
via email without speaking with you over the phone. Please do not contact
me anymore., my apologies for any inconvenience
Regards,
Engr Yohan Blake
Procurement Supervisor
Independent Feasibility/Project Management Consultant
Crude Oil & Products Trading Division
Asia Oil Refinery Sdn Bhd

subject: Re: Good day
body:
Hello Engr Yohan Blake,

Thank you for your response. I understand your concerns about dealing via email. It's always good to be cautious, isn't it? 

I'm curious though, could you tell me more about your role as a Supervisor in the Project Management Consultant at Asia Oil Refinery Sdn Bhd? It sounds like an interesting job!

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Alva
